intro: Guarea rovirosae, commonly known as the Rovirosa guarea, is a tropical tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes species known for their aromatic wood and medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and compound leaves with serrated edges. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are followed by elongated, woody fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
